Sentencas: Porous Ni-yttria stabilized zirconia (YSZ) composites are the most common materials used for solid oxide fuel cell anodes.
Titulo: Development and Characterization of Porous Composites for Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Anode Conduction Layers Using Ceramic-Filled Highly Porous Ni Foam

Sentencas: In conventional anodes, percolation of the Ni phase for acceptable conductivity requires relatively high Ni contents (i.e., > 35 vol% of solids) which can reduce cell reliability due to increased coefficient of thermal expansion (CTE) mismatch with the YSZ electrolyte and damage produced by redox cycling.
Titulo: Development and Characterization of Porous Composites for Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Anode Conduction Layers Using Ceramic-Filled Highly Porous Ni Foam

Sentencas: In this study, the incorporation of highly porous Ni foam into an anode structure was investigated in order to produce an anode conduction layer with high conductivity values at lower Ni volumes.
Titulo: Development and Characterization of Porous Composites for Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Anode Conduction Layers Using Ceramic-Filled Highly Porous Ni Foam

Sentencas: This was done by developing techniques for pasting various YSZ based slurries into a Ni foam structure followed by sintering.
Titulo: Development and Characterization of Porous Composites for Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Anode Conduction Layers Using Ceramic-Filled Highly Porous Ni Foam

Sentencas: The electrical conductivity, dimensional stability, and CTE of these structures were measured as a function of Ni, YSZ, and porous volume.
Titulo: Development and Characterization of Porous Composites for Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Anode Conduction Layers Using Ceramic-Filled Highly Porous Ni Foam

Sentencas: Sintered anodes made with Ni-foam exhibited a superior combination of conductivity and CTE compared with conventional anode structures.
Titulo: Development and Characterization of Porous Composites for Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Anode Conduction Layers Using Ceramic-Filled Highly Porous Ni Foam

Sentencas: For example, a Ni foam-YSZ composite with a nickel loading of 13 vol% has a CTE of 10.7 x 10(-6) K(-1), but with a similar electrical conductivity to a conventional anode (similar to 3000 S/cm) which requires at least 30 vol% Ni resulting in a CTE > 13 x 10(-6) K(-1).
Titulo: Development and Characterization of Porous Composites for Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Anode Conduction Layers Using Ceramic-Filled Highly Porous Ni Foam

Sentencas: Alteration of the paste composition produced a porous composite with engineered porosity and good dimensional stability.
Titulo: Development and Characterization of Porous Composites for Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Anode Conduction Layers Using Ceramic-Filled Highly Porous Ni Foam
